description.raw:
Fixes blender generated collada files with actors with multiple skeletons.

Actors generated in blender have a root node called for the Armature in the library\_animation, however a root node called dummy-root is generated when parsing the library\_controller. Since they have different names they are not merged even though the Armature contains all the nodes parsed in the library\_controller.

This behavior resulted in duplicated bones being added to the mesh, which resulted in OGRE crashing and failing to spawn the models.

Note that there is a possible memory leak \(also present before this commit\) in MergeSkeleton when assigning a new value to the Skeleton root, since a new tree is assigned but the old one \(dynamically allocated with new\) is not deleted.

I have a few ideas how to fix it but for now left as a TODO for documentation.
